name: CI/CD Pipelines
description: One challenge you'll face after containerizing your application is the need to manually rebuild and push for every code change. CI/CD pipelines automate this entire process - building, testing, and deploying your application every time changes are made, ensuring a smooth and reliable development workflow.

learning_steps.description: Learn the fundamentals of continuous integration and continuous deployment.

learning_steps.title: CI vs Continuous Delivery vs Continuous Deployment
learning_steps.description: Understand the differences between continuous integration, continuous delivery, and continuous deployment.
Learn about implementing CI/CD pipelines with these tools:

Set up a basic CI/CD pipeline for your containerized application:

1. Use GitHub Actions (or your preferred tool) to automatically:
   • Build your application
   • Run tests
   • Build a Docker image
   • Push the image to a container registry
2. Configure the pipeline to trigger on code commits to your main branch
3. Add a notification system for successful deployments or failures
Basic workflow for building and pushing Docker images:
learning_steps.code:
name: Build and Push

on:
  push:
    branches: [main]

jobs:
  build:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      
      - name: Build Docker image
        run: docker build -t myapp:${{ github.sha }} .
      
      - name: Login to Registry
        run: echo ${{ secrets.REGISTRY_PASSWORD }} | docker login -u ${{ secrets.REGISTRY_USER }} --password-stdin
      
      - name: Push image
        run: docker push myapp:${{ github.sha }}

learning_steps.description:
Implement a multi-environment deployment pipeline:

1. Deploy to staging first
2. Run automated tests against staging
3. Require manual approval for production
4. Promote to production after approval

questions.prompt: Walk me through the differences between Continuous Integration, Continuous Delivery, and Continuous Deployment.
scenario_seeds: Your engineering manager asks you to present the CI/CD strategy options to stakeholders who are deciding how much automation the team should adopt for their e-commerce platform
A regulated fintech company wants to adopt modern DevOps practices but needs manual approval gates for compliance - explain how continuous delivery fits their needs
During a post-mortem, the team debates whether a production bug would have been caught earlier with better CI practices - explain how each CI/CD stage prevents different types of issues
questions.grading_rubric: Must clearly distinguish all three concepts AND explain the role of automated testing in CI AND clarify when manual vs automatic deployment is appropriate.

questions.prompt: Walk me through the typical stages in a CI/CD pipeline for a containerized application.
scenario_seeds: You're setting up the first CI/CD pipeline for a team that's been deploying manually - walk them through each stage and why it matters
A pipeline is taking 45 minutes to run and developers are frustrated - explain the stages and where optimizations could happen
Your team is debugging a failed deployment and needs to understand which pipeline stage caught the issue - walk through what each stage validates
questions.grading_rubric: Must describe the complete pipeline flow from code commit to deployment AND explain what happens at each stage AND address how artifacts flow between stages.
